title: FC Levski Karlovo
text:
Levski Karlovo () is a <a href="Bulgaria">Bulgaria</a>n <a href="association%20football">football</a> club based in <a href="Karlovo">Karlovo</a>, <a href="Plovdiv%20Province">Plovdiv Province</a>. Founded in 1923, it currently competes in the <a href="Third%20Amateur%20Football%20League%20%28Bulgaria%29">South-East Third League</a>. The club's colors are blue and white. Levski Karlovo is where Bulgarian international <a href="Petar%20Aleksandrov">Petar Aleksandrov</a> began his career.
History.
1923–2004.
Since its founding in 1923, Levski has had 10 seasons in <a href="Bulgarian%20Second%20League">second division</a>, finishing third in 1975, with the last one being in 1981/82, when they finished 17th. <a href="Petar%20Aleksandrov">Petar Aleksandrov</a> made his debut during that season, scoring 10 goals in 22 matches, before joining <a href="PFC%20Slavia%20Sofia">Slavia Sofia</a>.
2004–2016: Re-founding.
The club was dissolved in 2004 only to be re-established later that year. It remained in third division until 2016, when it was promoted.
2016–present: Return to Professional Football.
On 27 July 2016, Levski was promoted to the newly formed <a href="Bulgarian%20Second%20League">Bulgarian Second League</a>. On 8 August 2016, after 34 years in the amateur leagues, the club returned to professional football in a match against <a href="FC%20Lokomotiv%201929%20Sofia">Lokomotiv Sofia</a> on 8 August 2016, which they lost 2:3. On 20 September 2016, <a href="FC%20Vereya">Vereya</a> beat Levski with 2:0 in the <a href="2016%E2%80%9317%20Bulgarian%20Cup">First Round</a> of Bulgarian Cup. After 9 defeats in their first 9 matches for the season, Levski finally notched a 2:0 win over <a href="PFC%20Bansko">PFC Bansko</a> on 22 September 2016. On 10 December 2016, they defeated group leader <a href="OFC%20Etar%20Veliko%20Tarnovo">Etar Veliko Tarnovo</a> 2:0. After finishing 16th in the table, the club was relegated back to third division for the 2017/18 season.
